availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Vance (Morgan County, KY, farmer and corporal 1st Reg Capital Guards (USA))

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Married to Rhoda Vance. Father of William H. Vance, James W. Vance, Sarah J. Vance, Alexander Vance, Jacob Vance, Louisa Vance, Nancy Vance, George Vance, Almira Vance, and Mary E Vance. Served in the Sandy Valley Battalion of the 1st Regiment Capital Guards (U.S.A.) as a corporal from July 6, 1864, to March 11, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, Division 2, p. 398.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 773.
